abstract: New York State attorney general's office is investigating whether Boy Scouts of America's hiring practices discriminate against homosexuals, and will ask chief scout executive Wayne Brock for details about employment decisions; request comes weeks after Boy Scouts' New York City affiliate announced it hired gay Eagle Scout Pascal Tessier.
lead_paragraph: The attorney general’s office says it has received information indicating that scouts’ policy conflicts with an affiliate’s recent hiring of a gay Eagle Scout.

headline.main: New York Investigates Whether Boy Scouts’ Employment Practices Discriminated Against Gays
headline.print_headline: State Investigates Whether Boy Scouts’ Employment Practices Discriminated Against Gays

snippet: The attorney general’s office says it has received information indicating that scouts’ policy conflicts with an affiliate’s recent hiring of a gay Eagle Scout.
